result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damon Elijah Moore

Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Damon Elijah Moore in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible, but refused to be interviewed today.
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/05/2022@2:00pm
